intro: Schismus tenuis, commonly known as the narrowleaf schismus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Schismus tenuis is often found in regions with a temperate climate and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient environments.
